title: Task 29

question.text: According to Alice, what kinds of meetings do video conferencing tools allow you to have?

answers.answer: Meetings where people send text messages to each other
answers.feedback: This option involves text messages and doesn't include real-time conversation with video.

answers.answer: Meetings where people share documents without speaking
answers.feedback: Sharing documents is part of online collaboration, but it doesn't define a face-to-face meeting.

answers.answer: Meetings where people write letters to each other
answers.feedback: Writing letters is a traditional way of communication and not the same as real-time online interaction.

answers.answer: Meetings where people talk and see each other through the computer or phone

dialogue.text: Video conferencing tools also made it possible for teams to have face-to-face meetings online.

description:
Face-to-face means you and someone else can see each other directly. It's like having a conversation with a friend or a teacher when you can see their face and they can see yours.

Example: Even though we are in different countries, we can still have face-to-face meetings online using video conferencing tools.
